parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: Identifies the required operation to be executed for a Trade Finance contract. The following codes are valid:O - Open new Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection contract, P - Preadvise new Letter of Credit contract, A - Amend an existing Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection contract, C - Direct charge processing for an existing contract, T - Trace existing Documentary Collection contract, D - Decision on an Amendment, M - Ancillary Trade Structured Message.

responseCode.description: The user input to accept/reject the override.

chargeAccountIds.description: Indicates the account to which the charges has to be levied. Used when charges are to be taken from a separate account

chargeAccountId.description: Indicates the account to which the charges has to be levied. Used when charges are to be taken from a separate account

messageFromBank.description: Field to input queries/clarifications by bank to be sought from Corporate customer on the request.

messageFromCustomer.description: Field to input any additional information/clarifications to be provided to the bank, by Corporate customer.

supportDocument.description: Holds the file name of the attached/uploaded documents.

supportDocuments.description: Holds the file name of the attached/uploaded documents.

consolidatedDiscrepancy.description: Consolidates the discrepancies that are specified in the fields DISCREPANCY,DEF.DISCREPANCY and the DOC.DISCREPANCY fields. The discrepancies listed in this field will only be relayed in the MT734/MT750 OUTWARD swift message.When an Inward MT734/750 is received in T24 the discrepancies listed in the message are mapped to this field.

discrepancyStatus.description: Specifies the current status of each discrepancies

presentorId.description: This field is used to identify the presentor of the documents if they are not a customer of the bank with a valid CUSTOMER.NO.Optionally input, identifies the presentor customer.

overrides.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

override.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

drawingType.description: This field is correlated to the other field payment type and identifies the Draw type under Letter of credit. Whether its a sight LC payment, acceptance, deferred payment or Mixed payment.

currencyId.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

documentAmount.description: This field contains the amount to be drawn under this transaction, expressed in the currency above (DRAW.CURRENCY).

valueDate.description: Indicates the value date on which the underlying accounting entry is to be given value (for interest purposes)

debitAccountId.description: Indicates the debit account number of the payment or transaction.

creditAccountId.description: Credit account identifier of the payment or transaction

creditAmount.description: Amount to be credited in a payment transaction

discrepancyResponse.description: Field to record the Applicant's response to discrepancies in the documents under LC.

eventStatus.description: Specifies the status of the request.Allowed values are - With Bank_With Customer_Approved_Rejected.

presentorCustomerId.description: This field identifies the presentor of the documents if they are a customer of the bank with a valid CUSTOMER.NO.

recordStatus.description: General status of the record. Possible values: - null - authorised - IHLD - input, on hold - INAU - input, not authorised - INA2 - input, authorised, pending second authorisation - INAO - input, not authorised with blocking overrides - RNAU - reversed, not authorised - RNAO - reversed, not authorised with blocking overrides

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

The amount will be expressed in the currency of the letter of credit (LC.CURRENCY).

tenor.description: This field is valid for Documentary Collections only. It is used in conjunction with the following field 'DAYS' or 'COLL.MAT.CODE' to indicate the TENOR of the drafts under the collection and is used in the production of corresponding Collection messages.

recordStatus.description: General status of the record. Possible values: - null - authorised - IHLD - input, on hold - INAU - input, not authorised - INA2 - input, authorised, pending second authorisation - INAO - input, not authorised with blocking overrides - RNAU - reversed, not authorised - RNAO - reversed, not authorised with blocking overrides

externalReference.description: For Export/Advising Letter of Credit this is the Issuing Bank's/Opener's reference.

chargesAccountId.description: This field identifies the account from which related charges will be taken, if any.Any valid account number can be entered in this field.

commissionAccountId.description: This is the account for paying the commission at the Schedule date.

provisionAccountId.description: This field is used to determine the account from which the provision should be debited when such a transaction is deemed to require provision.

provisionAmount.description: This field is used to register any changes in the amount of provision held.

documentId.description: Based on documentCode, the field defaults the required document codes

ibStatus.description: Field to indicate the status of LC request through internet banking.

advisingBankCustomerId.description: This field is mandatory for Import Letter of Credits and contains the customer number or mnemonic of the advising bank.

issuingBankId.description: Identifies the Issuing bank ID under the LC, who issues the LC under when a bank is advising the Letter of Credit

closingDate.description: Indicates the date that the LC is due to be closed, and written to the history files. If any drawings are outstanding on this date for the LC, then the LC will not be closed.

availableWithCustomerId.description: Used for the production of letter of credit messages/advices, this field identifies the bank authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate documents presented under the L/C if it is not a customer of the bank with a valid CUSTOMER.NO.

documentsReceived.description: Indicates that when an outward collection is initiated through internet banking, this field specifies if original documents have been received by the bank.

applicantCustomerName.description: This field identifies the applicant on whose behalf the Letter of Credit is issued, if the applicant is held on the CUSTOMER file.

advisingBanks.description: Identifies the advising bank under the Letter of Credit, through whom the Letter of Credit is to be advised to the second advising bank or beneficiary

advisingBank.description: Identifies the advising bank under the Letter of Credit, through whom the Letter of Credit is to be advised to the second advising bank or beneficiary

beneficiaryCustomerName.description: Specifies the name and address of the beneficiary of the guarantee request.

availableWith.description: Used for the production of letter of credit messages/advices, this field identifies the bank authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate documents presented under the L/C if it is not a customer of the bank with a valid CUSTOMER.NO.

additionalAmountsCovered.description: Specifies any additional amounts available under the Letter of Credit, such as insurance, freight, interest, etc.

additionalAmountCovered.description: Specifies any additional amounts available under the Letter of Credit, such as insurance, freight, interest, etc.

deferredPayment.description: This free text field will specify the payment date or method for its determination for which deferred payment or a Negotiation drawings will be made under the LC.

contactInformation.description: Free text field to hold telephone numbers or email address for applicant bankers to contact when LC initiated through Internet Banking.

shipmentPeriods.description: Indicates the period of time which the goods are to be loaded on board/dispatched/taken in charge.

shipmentPeriod.description: Indicates the period of time which the goods are to be loaded on board/dispatched/taken in charge.

presentationPeriod.description: Used for the production of messages/advices this field specifies the number of days after the date of issuance of the transports document(s) within which the documents must be presented for payment, acceptance or negotiation.

descriptionOfGoods.description: Indicate the details of the amendment to the description of the goods under a Letter of Credit contract. The text to begin with the valid codes: ADD or DELETE or REPALL

descriptionOfGood.description: Used for the creation of messages/advices, this free text field is used to identify the description of the goods covered by the transaction.

documentCode.description: Required documents under a Letter of Credit

document1stCopy.description: Used in the production of messages/advices, this field in conjunction with <DOCUMENT.CODE> is used to identify the number of each document being sent in the first mailing to the respective party.

documentText.description: Specifies the description of document code

documentsRequired.description: Free textfield used to describe the documents to be presented under the letter of credit, in addition to the predefined documents associated with documentCode.

documentRequired.description: Free textfield used to describe the documents to be presented under the letter of credit, in addition to the predefined documents associated with documentCode.

clausesText.description: Contains the full clause text which is used in the construction of L/C Advices/Documents generated as a result of L/C transactions.

additionalConditions.description: Amendment details to the additional conditions under a LC contract. Must begin with the valid codes: ADD or DELETE or REPALL.

additionalCondition.description: Amendment details to the additional conditions under a LC contract. Must begin with the valid codes: ADD or DELETE or REPALL.

narrativeCharges.description: Field to specify the details of the charges to be borne by the beneficiary

narrativeCharge.description: Field to specify the details of the charges to be borne by the beneficiary

fromCustomerMessage.description: This field indicates that message from the customer

issuingBank.description: This field identifies the Issuing Bank for an Export Letter of Credit and the Collecting Bank for an Outward Documentary Collection.

documentName.description: Holds the file name of the attached/uploaded documents.

instruction.description: Used in the generation of messages/advices, this field can be used to stiputate any special or additional instructions to the Paying/Accepting/Negotiating Bank.

ibReason.description: This field holds the reason for change in IB.STATUS field.

overrides.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

override.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

guaranteeId.description: The identifier of the guarantee record

clientReference.description: To specify the Corporate customer's reference.

issueDate.description: The date the item was issued.

currencyId.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

adviceExpiryDate.description: Specifies the actual expiry date of Guarantee.

expiryPlace.description: Expiry place for presentation under the documentary credit.

applicantCustomerId.description: This field identifies the applicant on whose behalf the Letter of Credit is issued, if the applicant is held on the CUSTOMER file.

percentageCreditAmount.description: Used to define the percentage to be added to the letter of credit amount (LC.AMOUNT) to calculate the full liability amount or maximum amount that can be drawn.

percentageDebitAmount.description: This field specifies the negative tolerance relative to the documentary credit amount as a percentage.

maximumCreditAmount.description: Indicates the maximum amount that can be drawn under this Letter of Credit.

payTerms.description: This field is used to decide the pay type for LC when LC initiated through Internet Banking.

tenor.description: This field is valid for Documentary Collections only. It is used in conjunction with the following field 'DAYS' or 'COLL.MAT.CODE' to indicate the TENOR of the drafts under the collection and is used in the production of corresponding Collection messages.

incoTerms.description: This field holds the valid incoterms code

transferable.description: This field is used to decide whether LC is tranferrable or not when LC initiated through Internet Banking.

confirmInstructions.description: This field contains confirmation instructions for the Receiver.

standByLC.description: This field is used to decide whether LC is STANBY or not when LC initiated through Internet Banking.

limitBroken.description: when a CRITICAL limit override message is received. Additional information may be added here for the Credit Officer of the account .

partialShipmentText.description: This field holds the details of Part Shipment.

transhipments.description: Identifies if transhipments are allowed under the terms of the LC. Valid codes are ALLOWED, CONDITIONAL, and NOT ALLOWED.

shipmentDespatch.description: This Multi-value field indicates the place of Dispatch or Taking in charge of the goods or Loading on board.Used for the production of documents and advice, stipulates the place of Dispatch or Taking in charge of the goods or Loading on board for shipments made under the Letter of Credit.

otherDespatchDetails.description: It denotes the Port of Loading/Airport of Departure.populated to 44E tag of 707 message.

transportation.description: Indicates the final destination of the goods.Used for the production of documents and advice stipulated, the final destination of the goods shipped under the Letter of Credit.

finalDestination.description: Indicates the final destination or place of delivery of the shipment under the LC.

latestShipmentDate.description: Latest date for loading on board/dispatch/taking in charge for goods shipped under the LC.

availableBy.description: This field identifies the how the credit is available under Letter of Credit.

lcType.description: Indicates the type of LC, whether this is an Import/Export, Confirmed/Unconfirmed/Revolving/Transferrable/Back to Back LC/documentary collection/Clean collection etc.

shipmentMode.description: This field is used to define the mode of shipment used to transport goods.

applicantAccountId.description: Defines the default account to be used for reimbursement from the Applicant in the case of an Import Letter of Credit and the Drawee in the event of an Inward Collection.

expiryDate.description: The date an agreement such as an arrangement, product, credit facility or limit is due to expire

days.description: Valid for Documentary Collections and used in conjunction with the field TENOR to indicate the tenor of the drafts under the collection. It is used in the production of corresponding documentary collection messages and to support Option K of Tag 32a of SWIFT MT400, accepts D or M followed by number representing number of Days or number of Months.

collectionMaturityCode.description: This field indicates the codes available for the drafts under a collection.

dateAccepted.description: This field is valid for Documentary Collections Only. It records the maturity date as advised by the Collecting Bank of a usance draft accepted payable by the Drawee.

beneficiaryAccountId.description: Unique account identifier of the beneficiary account number.

operation.description: Identifies the required operation to be executed for a Trade Finance contract. Input of valid codes as: O for opening of LC, P for Pre-advise of LC, A for Amend LC, C for Collect Charges, D for Decision on Amendments, T for Tracer, IO for LC through Internet Banking Operation and M for Ancillary Message (MT759)

provision.description: This field turns on the Provision processing for import Letters of Credit and export confirmed LCs.. When this field is set to 'YES' , an account/percentage provision can be entered. The system will then calculate (using the percentage entered) a provision amount, which will be passed to the Provision.amount field.

chargesFrom.description: Code to identify from whom the bank is to claim its charges. Allowed values: - O(pener) - B(eneficiary) - T(hird Party)

beneficiaryCustomerId.description: Identifies the Customer who is to be the ultimate receiver of the funds transferred by the sending bank when this Beneficiary is not a bank.

recordStatus.description: General status of the record. Possible values: - null - authorised - IHLD - input, on hold - INAU - input, not authorised - INA2 - input, authorised, pending second authorisation - INAO - input, not authorised with blocking overrides - RNAU - reversed, not authorised - RNAO - reversed, not authorised with blocking overrides
